t: Birth of the King in Bethlehem
“Now*pn muster yourselves in troops, daughter of troops; They*ln have laid siege against us; With*ln a rod they will smite the judge of Israel on the cheek.

But*ln as for you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, Too*iln little to be among the clans of Judah, From*ln you One will go forth for Me to be ruler in Israel. His*ln goings forth are from long ago, From*ln the days of eternity.”
Therefore*ln He will give them up*i until the time When*ln she who is in labor has borne a child. Then*ln the remainder of His brethren Will*ln return to the sons of Israel.

And*ln He will arise and shepherd His*i flock*i In*ln the strength of the Lord,*s In*ln the majesty of the name of the Lord*s His God. And*ln they will remain, Because*ln at that time He will be great To*ln the ends of the earth.
This*ln One will be our*i peace. When*bln the Assyrian invades our land, When*ln he tramples on our citadels, Then*ln we will raise against him Seven*ln shepherds and eight leaders of men.

They*ln will shepherd the land of Assyria with the sword, The*ln land of Nimrod at its entrances; And*ln He will deliver us*i from the Assyrian When*ln he attacks our land And*ln when he tramples our territory.
Then*ln the remnant of Jacob Will*ln be among many peoples Like*ln dew from the Lord,*s Like*ln showers on vegetation Which*ln do not wait for man Or*ln delay for the sons of men.

The*ln remnant of Jacob Will*ln be among the nations, Among*ln many peoples Like*ln a lion among the beasts of the forest, Like*ln a young lion among flocks of sheep, Which,*ln if he passes through, Tramples*ln down and tears, And*ln there is none to rescue.
Your*ln hand will be lifted up against your adversaries, And*ln all your enemies will be cut off.
“It*ln will be in that day,” declares the Lord,*s “That*ln I will cut off your horses from among you And*ln destroy your chariots.
I*ln will also cut off the cities of your land And*ln tear down all your fortifications.
I*ln will cut off sorceries from your hand, And*ln you will have fortune-tellers no more.
I*ln will cut off your carved images And*ln your sacred*i pillars from among you, So*ln that you will no longer bow down To*ln the work of your hands.
I*ln will root out your Asherim from among you And*ln destroy your cities.
And*ln I will execute vengeance in anger and wrath On*ln the nations which have not obeyed.”
